| adductor pollicis muscle |
| ulnar nerve |

In this paragraph, the two chemical entities are "adductor pollicis muscle" and "ulnar nerve." The adductor pollicis muscle is a muscle in the hand responsible for moving the thumb towards the palm, and the ulnar nerve is a nerve in the arm that provides motor function to the hand and sensation to the little finger and half of the ring finger.
